title: [regression] rclone 1.64.0 corrupts large files when uploading to Backblaze with rclone mount
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

When I mount a Backblaze bucket using `rclone mount` and upload a large file (bigger than 200 MiB, so that the chunked upload is used) using cp, the uploaded file has 96 MiB chunks in wrong order.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.64.0
- os/version: arch (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.5.5-arch1-1 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.21.1
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Arch Linux, 64 bit

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Backblaze

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
mkdir -p ~/mnt
dd if=/dev/urandom of=/tmp/test bs=1M count=300
rclone -vv --config ~/.config/rclone/rclone-test.conf mount test:testbucketname ~/mnt > /tmp/rclone-mount.log 2>&1 &
sleep 3
cp /tmp/test ~/mnt/test
sha256sum -b /tmp/test ~/mnt/test
rclone --config ~/.config/rclone/rclone-test.conf deletefile test:testbucketname/test
umount ~/mnt
```

With rclone 1.63.1 the SHA256 hash sums are equal, as expected. With rclone 1.64.0, however, they are different, and by looking at a hexdump it can be seen that 96 MiB chunks are shuffled in a wrong order.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

[rclone-mount.log](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/12893689/rclone-mount.log)

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
